label: Description
value: (a) Square base with bead molding and anthemion motifs on corners. Urn-shaped candleholder with four repoussé figures of Victory with palm leaf and laurel wreath above flower swags. (b) removable bobêche.

label: Provenance
value: Mrs. John Innes Kane; 1926: bequested to Museum

label: Credit line
value: Bequest of Mrs. John Innes Kane

label: Description
value: Baluster-form mug with scroll handle. Engraved "WEF" with asterick under the E.

label: Provenance
value: Mrs. John Innes Kane; 1926: bequested to Museum

label: Credit line
value: Bequest of Mrs. John Innes Kane

label: Description
value: Oval shape on three piereced legs and ball feet; cast ornamental border in leaf design.

label: Provenance
value: Mrs. John Innes Kane; 1926: bequested to Museum

label: Credit line
value: Bequest of Mrs. John Innes Kane

label: Description
value: Repoussé and chased with flowers, foliage on a granulated ground, the matching lid with terrapin turtle finial, plain liner with Rococo handles matching tureen handles.

label: Provenance
value: Mrs. John Innes Kane; 1926: bequested to Museum

label: Credit line
value: Bequest of Mrs. John Innes Kane

label: Credit line
value: Bequest of Mrs. John Innes Kane

label: Description
value: Elongated scallop-shell shaped bowl with perferations. Short curved handle with winged cherub's mask below a cast Cupid with flowers and rabbit.

label: Credit line
value: Bequest of Mrs. John Innes Kane

label: Description
value: Pear-shaped bowl stamped with four concentric ridges, the tapering reeded stem with rounded terminal, embossed with a a bird among flowering plants and grass. Reverse similarly embossed with vacant area.

label: Credit line
value: Bequest of Mrs. John Innes Kane

label: Description
value: Circular bowl with perforations in shape of a six-pointed star. Flaring edge with raised cord rim. Ebony handle.

label: Provenance
value: Mrs. John Innes Kane; 1926: bequested to Museum

label: Credit line
value: Bequest of Mrs. John Innes Kane

label: Description
value: Cylindrical cage (a) with animals and birds among leafy scrolls, in cut-out silver. Strap handle, flat on top. Hinged cover with shell thumbrest, and hole for spoon. Cylindrical, dark blue glass insert (b).

label: Credit line
value: Bequest of Mrs. John Innes Kane

label: Description
value: Twelve lobed oval bowl pierced in the center with four flowers and surrounded by pierced circles and stylized leaves. Reeded stem with fiddle-form terminal.

label: Credit line
value: Bequest of Mrs. John Innes Kane

label: Credit line
value: Bequest of Mrs. John Innes Kane

label: Credit line
value: Bequest of Mrs. John Innes Kane

label: Description
value: Egg-shaped, covered box; inside 'makiye' (aventurine) lacquer; outside cream and gold 'nashiji' ground decorated with swallows, maple leaves, and phoenix in gold

label: Credit line
value: Bequest of Mrs. John Innes Kane

label: Description
value: Painted paper leaf. Obverse: marriage in a garden with putti trying on classical armor. Reverse: plain. Carved and silvered mother-of-pearl sticks with floral and scroll decoration.

label: Physical description
value: Painted paper leaf, carved and silvered mother-of-pearl sticks

label: Provenance
value: Bequest of Mrs. John Innes Kane

label: Credit line
value: Bequest of Mrs. John Innes Kane

label: Description
value: Brisé fan. Ivory sticks carved à jour with Chinese figures in a landscape. Silk ribbon.

label: Credit line
value: Bequest of Mrs. John Innes Kane

label: Description
value: Shaped-front inlaid sideboard, tambour door below wide center drawer; square tapered legs; oval stamped brass drawer pulls.

label: Physical description
value: Mahogany, white pine, tulip, poplar, box (inlay), brass (pulls)

label: Provenance
value: Mrs. John Innes Kane; 1926: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Bequest of Mrs. John Innes Kane

label: Description
value: Bottle is cylindrical shape with glass wall in center dividing its length into two compartments. Wide, gold metal bands at each end, hinged to wider gold bands which hold piece of ruby glass with flattened spherical ends extending beyond, the two metal parts hinged to form covers with spring catcheds. Wad of chamois in each compartment

label: Dimensions
value: H x diam.: 6.9 x 1 cm (2 11/16 x 3/8 in.)

label: Provenance
value: Mrs. John Innes Kane; 1926: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Bequest of Mrs. John Innes Kane

label: Description
value:
C: Virgin Mary
D: St. Paul

label: Credit line
value: Bequest of Mrs. John Innes Kane

label: Description
value: “Ranelagh” type figures. A) A cavalier dressed in pink knee-breeches, a pink cloak, and orange waistcoat with flowers and green sleeves. B) Lady dressed in orange skirt with large rosettes, pink bodice edged with blue and a scarf floating from feathers on her head. At her feet, a mask. Both are standing on scrolling bases with gilding and are supported by bunches of flowers.

label: Provenance
value: Mrs. John Innes Kane; 1926: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Bequest of Mrs. John Innes Kane

label: Description
value: Maker is I Spies or Spits or Johann Spies

label: Physical description
value: gold, tortoise shell and mother of pearl

label: Credit line
value: Bequest of Mrs. John Innes Kane

label: Description
value: Glass candlestick with square base; a thin shaft near foot, with round drip pan with scalloped rim, garlands of beaded glass and hanging teardrops. Above this, straight wide shaft and open mouth for socket with small scalloped rim.

label: Provenance
value: Mrs. John Innes Kane; 1926: bequested to Museum

label: Credit line
value: Bequest of Mrs. John Innes Kane

label: Description
value: A pair of glass grape bunches

value: Bequest of Mrs. John Innes Kane

label: Description
value: A bulb pot in the form of a commode made in porcelain with gilt detail.

label: Provenance
value: Mrs. John Innes Kane; 1926: bequested to Museum

label: Credit line
value: Bequest of Mrs. John Innes Kane

label: Description
value: Part of horizontal rectangular panel of multiple tiles; slight marbelized framework at top and sides, rounded at corners.  Period harbor scene in dark purple (manganese) on white ground, showing anchored and tied-up craft in background, camel and human figures in foreground, trees, right and left, portion of a gateway at left.

label: Description
value: Horizontal rectangle.  Thirty tiles wide and twenty-three tiles high with opening for fireplace eleven tiles wide and ten high.  Foliage arabesques disposed about three vertical axes from which are emphazised by urns at center and right, and at left by the figure of a standing woman carrying an infant on her arm and accompanied by two children.
